results.title: Drums for a holiday
results.creator_credit: A R Taylor, Peter Stiles and Anglo-Scottish Pictures
results.brief_description: This film looks at the Gold Coast (now Ghana), its history, industries and export trade in cotton and cocoa, and social and political life. Half of the world’s cocoa comes from this region, and the harvesting, fermenting, drying, grading according to quality, and selling and shipping of the beans is illustrated. The film records a ceremonial parade to the local Durbar attended by the King of Ashanti, village Chiefs, and British representatives. Commentary by Leo Genn; photography by Stanley Gooze and edited by John Ferris

results.title: Drummer Hoff (K)
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel, William Snyder and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: This film is a lively folk verse about the building of a cannon called the Sultan. Brightly dressed in full uniform, each soldier brings a part of the remarkable machine. Based on the book by Barbara and Ed Emberly.

results.title: Drugstore cowboy
results.creator_credit: Gus Van Sant, Karen Murphy, Nick Wechsler and Avenue Pictures
results.brief_description: Gus Van Sant’s cynical but never moralistic story about a junkie couple whose domestic life centres on the pursuit of drugs. Matt Dillon and Kelly Lynch are outstanding as a couple of drifters who are not afraid to state their love for the pleasurable highs that drugs offer: compared to the existences of other people they meet in small-town America, they don’t think they are doing so badly. Alternating between the comic and the bleak, “Drugstore Cowboy” reveals the excess and pain of drug addiction but its sharp, cool and irreverent tone never condescends to, or patronises the viewer. Features an hilarious cameo by William Burroughs as a smacked-out priest.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gus Van Sant, Karen Murphy, Nick Wechsler and Avenue Pictures

results.title: Drugs: The Children are choosing - The Need for dialogue
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
Reports on a conference in which students and teachers have difficulties in communicating about drugs. Finally the frustrations and problems childhood emerge and it is suggested that it is no wonder young people turn to drugs for escape and pleasure.

results.title: Drugs: it's up to you really

results.title: Drugs: a primary film
results.brief_description: Presents vignettes of situations familiar to children to explore the correct use of drugs by the doctor and at home. Reveals the danger of drug misuse and emphasises the positive attitudes needed for a rich and healthy life. Suitable for upper primary level.
